TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed LazyThreadSafetyMode extends System.Enum

summary.span: Specifies how a instance synchronizes access among multiple threads.

span.span: Specifies how a instance synchronizes access among multiple threads.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use esta enumeração para especificar o `mode` parâmetro construtores.Use this enumeration to specify the `mode` parameter of constructors. Os efeitos de todos os construtores na sincronização de thread podem ser descritos em termos esta enumeração tenham ou não `mode` parâmetros.The effects of all constructors on thread synchronization can be described in terms of this enumeration, whether or not they have `mode` parameters. Um instância é inicializada por um método de inicialização especificado pelo usuário ou pelo construtor padrão para `T`.A instance is initialized either by a user-specified initialization method or by the default constructor for `T`. O método de inicialização for especificado o `valueFactory` parâmetro de um construtor.The initialization method is specified by the `valueFactory` parameter of a constructor. O método retorna uma instância de `T`, que é o tipo que é instanciado lentamente pela instância do .The method returns an instance of `T`, which is the type that is lazily instantiated by the instance of . Se um construtor não tiver um `valueFactory` parâmetro, o construtor padrão para `T` é usado para inicializar o instância.If a constructor does not have a `valueFactory` parameter, the default constructor for `T` is used to initialize the instance. Em ambos os casos, a inicialização ocorre na primeira vez que você chamar o propriedade.In either case, initialization occurs the first time you call the property. Além de especificar a segurança de thread de um instância, esta enumeração afeta o cache de exceções.In addition to specifying the thread safety of a instance, this enumeration affects exception caching. Quando exceções são armazenados em cache para um instância, você obtém apenas uma chance para inicializar a instância.When exceptions are cached for a instance, you get only one chance to initialize the instance. Se uma exceção será lançada na primeira vez que você chamar o propriedade, que a exceção é armazenado em cache e lançada novamente em todas as chamadas subsequentes para o propriedade.If an exception is thrown the first time you call the property, that exception is cached and rethrown on all subsequent calls to the property. A vantagem de exceções de cache é que qualquer dois threads sempre obtém o mesmo resultado, mesmo quando ocorrem erros.The advantage of caching exceptions is that any two threads always get the same result, even when errors occur. Quando você especificar o modo de PublicationOnly, exceções nunca são armazenadas em cache.When you specify the PublicationOnly mode, exceptions are never cached. Quando você especificar nenhuma ou ExecutionAndPublication, cache depende se você especifica um método de inicialização ou permitir que o construtor padrão para `T` a ser usado.When you specify None or ExecutionAndPublication, caching depends on whether you specify an initialization method or allow the default constructor for `T` to be used. Especificar um método de inicialização permite o cache de exceções para esses dois modos.Specifying an initialization method enables exception caching for these two modes. O método de inicialização pode ser muito simples.The initialization method can be very simple. Por exemplo, ele pode chamar o construtor padrão para `T`: `new Lazy(() => new Contents(), mode)` em C# ou `New Lazy(Of Contents)(Function() New Contents())` no Visual Basic.For example, it might call the default constructor for `T`: `new Lazy(() => new Contents(), mode)` in C#, or `New Lazy(Of Contents)(Function() New Contents())` in Visual Basic. Se você usar um construtor que não especifica um método de inicialização, exceções que são geradas pelo construtor padrão para `T` não são armazenados em cache.If you use a constructor that does not specify an initialization method, exceptions that are thrown by the default constructor for `T` are not cached. A tabela a seguir resume o comportamento do cache de exceção.The following table summarizes exception caching behavior. |ModoMode|Usando o método de inicializaçãoUsing initialization method|Usando o construtor padrão para `T`Using default constructor for `T`| |----------|---------------------------------|---------------------------------------| |NenhumNone|Armazenado em cacheCached|Não armazenado em cacheNot cached| |PublicationOnlyPublicationOnly|Não armazenado em cacheNot cached|Não armazenado em cacheNot cached| |ExecutionAndPublicationExecutionAndPublication|Armazenado em cacheCached|Não armazenado em cacheNot cached|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.LazyThreadSafetyMode ExecutionAndPublication = int32(2)

summary.span: Locks are used to ensure that only a single thread can initialize a instance in a thread-safe manner.

span.span: Locks are used to ensure that only a single thread can initialize a instance in a thread-safe manner.

summary.span: If the initialization method (or the default constructor, if there is no initialization method) uses locks internally, deadlocks can occur.

span.span: If the initialization method (or the default constructor, if there is no initialization method) uses locks internally, deadlocks can occur.

summary.span: If you use a constructor that specifies an initialization method ( parameter), and if that initialization method throws an exception (or fails to handle an exception) the first time you call the property, then the exception is cached and thrown again on subsequent calls to the property.

span.span: If you use a constructor that specifies an initialization method ( parameter), and if that initialization method throws an exception (or fails to handle an exception) the first time you call the property, then the exception is cached and thrown again on subsequent calls to the property.

summary.span: If you use a constructor that does not specify an initialization method, exceptions that are thrown by the default constructor for are not cached.

span.span: If you use a constructor that does not specify an initialization method, exceptions that are thrown by the default constructor for are not cached.

summary.span: In that case, a subsequent call to the property might successfully initialize the instance.

span.span: In that case, a subsequent call to the property might successfully initialize the instance.

summary.span: If the initialization method recursively accesses the property of the instance, an is thrown.

span.span: If the initialization method recursively accesses the property of the instance, an is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.LazyThreadSafetyMode None = int32(0)

summary.span: The instance is not thread safe; if the instance is accessed from multiple threads, its behavior is undefined.

span.span: The instance is not thread safe; if the instance is accessed from multiple threads, its behavior is undefined.

summary.span: Use this mode only when high performance is crucial and the instance is guaranteed never to be initialized from more than one thread.

span.span: Use this mode only when high performance is crucial and the instance is guaranteed never to be initialized from more than one thread.

summary.span: If you use a constructor that specifies an initialization method ( parameter), and if that initialization method throws an exception (or fails to handle an exception) the first time you call the property, then the exception is cached and thrown again on subsequent calls to the property.

span.span: If you use a constructor that specifies an initialization method ( parameter), and if that initialization method throws an exception (or fails to handle an exception) the first time you call the property, then the exception is cached and thrown again on subsequent calls to the property.

summary.span: If you use a constructor that does not specify an initialization method, exceptions that are thrown by the default constructor for are not cached.

span.span: If you use a constructor that does not specify an initialization method, exceptions that are thrown by the default constructor for are not cached.

summary.span: In that case, a subsequent call to the property might successfully initialize the instance.

span.span: In that case, a subsequent call to the property might successfully initialize the instance.

summary.span: If the initialization method recursively accesses the property of the instance, an is thrown.

span.span: If the initialization method recursively accesses the property of the instance, an is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Threading.LazyThreadSafetyMode PublicationOnly = int32(1)

summary.span: When multiple threads try to initialize a instance simultaneously, all threads are allowed to run the initialization method (or the default constructor, if there is no initialization method).

span.span: When multiple threads try to initialize a instance simultaneously, all threads are allowed to run the initialization method (or the default constructor, if there is no initialization method).

summary.span: The first thread to complete initialization sets the value of the instance.

span.span: The first thread to complete initialization sets the value of the instance.

summary.span: That value is returned to any other threads that were simultaneously running the initialization method, unless the initialization method throws exceptions on those threads.

span.span: That value is returned to any other threads that were simultaneously running the initialization method, unless the initialization method throws exceptions on those threads.

summary.span: Any instances of that were created by the competing threads are discarded.

span.span: Any instances of that were created by the competing threads are discarded.

summary.span: If the initialization method throws an exception on any thread, the exception is propagated out of the property on that thread.

span.span: If the initialization method throws an exception on any thread, the exception is propagated out of the property on that thread.

summary.span: The exception is not cached.

span.span: The exception is not cached.

summary.span: The value of the property remains , and subsequent calls to the property, either by the thread where the exception was thrown or by other threads, cause the initialization method to run again.

span.span: The value of the property remains , and subsequent calls to the property, either by the thread where the exception was thrown or by other threads, cause the initialization method to run again.

summary.span: If the initialization method recursively accesses the property of the instance, no exception is thrown.

span.span: If the initialization method recursively accesses the property of the instance, no exception is thrown.
